meanings.definition: To laugh louder or more heartily than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outlaugh her friends during funny movies.
meanings.sent2: It's not polite to outlaugh others when they are sharing a joke.
meanings.sent3: At the comedy show, she managed to outlaugh even the comedian!
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter could outlaugh a room full of giggling children.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her outlaughing echoed through the entire theater.

meanings.sent1: He would outlaugh everyone at the party with his booming laughter.
meanings.sent2: The joke was so funny that it made him outlaugh everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: His ability to outlaugh others made him the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: His laughter could outlaugh even the loudest thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The joy in his heart made him outlaugh all his worries and fears.
